description:
Solis
Sanctorum
The central church of Celestia, It now serves as the main church of the Second Light.

Solis
Once home to Celestia's original church. It has became the capital of the Second Light, remaining the heart of their power and belief.

Furst Cradle
Bashan Wall
An immense wall built by the Bastioners of Nox. It now begins to crumble.

Furst Cradle
Furstholm
One of the oldest cities in Nox. It was built during the First Light as a stronghold from monsters from the north.

Furst Cradle
Windmills
These mills serve both to grind grain into flour and to act as watchtowers against seafaring raiders.

Zalt
Zalt'Elm
An ancient tower-academy rising from a saltwater island, its stone soaked in sea-mist and crashing waves. Sanctioned by the old Church of Celestia, it remains the foremost authority on magic in Nox.

Plunderer's Keep
A long-abandoned castle from before the Zenith of Day, stripped over time for stone and treasure. Now, little remains but a hollow and scattered ruin.

The Bleeding Mountains
The Red Falls
Iron oxide from the mountains freeze in the glacial lakes. As the snowy mountain caps melt, the waterfalls run red as though bleeding.

The Candles (Eastern)
Sedimentary rock formations, worn by time into towering, candle-like spires that stretch into the sea.

The Candles (Southern)
Sedimentary rock formations, worn by time into towering, candle-like spires that stretch into the sea.

The Sea of Glass
The crater left where Celestia fell. The sand has turned to glass for miles in all directions.

The Godhold
The City of Rags
A sea of tents surrounds the Reliquary, a makeshift city born from countless pilgrims drawn by faith. Struggling under the overpopulation, the city is ravaged by diseases like the deadly Scar Scale.

The Godhold
The Reliquary
The Reliquary is the Custodiate's stronghold, encasing the sacred body of Celestia. Nearly impenetrable, it stands as both the main church and the heart of the Custodiate's power.

The Godhold
Dustmere
Dustmere is the old city's heart, where nobles and wealthy merchants remain. Those who couldn't adapt have fled or been swallowed by the city. Those who remain are amongst the richest in all of Nox.

The Godhold
Godhold Tower
A tower built by the Custodiate to monitor the city and enforce law.
